Description: A vehicle fitted with ablative armour treats the first non-Glancing Hit it suffers to the Body location in each battle as a Glancing Hit.
A vehicle fitted with a crash cage treats the first non-Glancing Hit it suffers to the Crew location in each battle as a Glancing Hit.
When rolling on the Lasting Injury table for the crew of a vehicle fitted with escape hatches, the result may be re-rolled. The second result must be kept even if it is worse than the first.
The first head-on collision this vehicle is involved in, the other object also suffers a S5, AP -2, D2 hit in addition to any other effects.
A vehicle fitted with extra armour increases its Toughness characteristic by 1 in all locations.

When activated, any model embarked upon a vehicle with a transport cage with at least one Fire Point may perform the following actions as part of their activation: Shoot (Basic) and Reload (Simple). The shooting attack is resolved as if emanating from the Fire Point (place the Vision Arc template against the Fire Point to check what the fighter can see). Each Fire Point may only have one fighter fire form it each round.
A vehicle fitted with a ram adds 1 to the Strength, AP and Damage of any vehicle impacts involving its Front arc.
A vehicle fitted with reinforced armour increases its starting HP by 1.
A vehicle fitted with a rockgrinder ram adds 2 to the Strength, AP and Damage of any vehicle impacts involving its Front arc.
If a model equipped with speed fins does not make any turns during its activation, it may increase its Movement characteristic by 1".

A defined area (which must be clear on the model) of a vehicle fitted with a transport bed. This means that fighters on that area do not have to check to see if they fall off when the vehicle moves. The number of fighters who can fit on a transport bed is determined by the number that can physically fit on the transport bed as modelled on the vehicle.

When deploying at the start of a battle, up to 3 fighters can be deployed embarked upon a vehicle with a small transport cage as long as the vehicle is already deployed upon the battlefield; fighters cannot start embarked upon a vehicle that is in Reinforcements. Note that fighters subject to the mounted condition and Brutes cannot enter a transport cage.

When deploying at the start of a battle, up to 6 fighters can be deployed embarked upon a vehicle with a large transport cage as long as the vehicle is already deployed upon the battlefield; fighters cannot start embarked upon a vehicle that is in Reinforcements. Note that fighters subject to the mounted condition and Brutes cannot enter a transport cage.
A vehicle with a turtle back does not automatically become Wrecked if it rolls due to failing a Loss of Control test. Instead it loses two Hull points and auto rights itself after resolving the roll.
A vehicle fitted with this Upgrade adds one Weapon Hardpoint. This Upgrade can be taken multiple times.
This vehicle counts as an Ammo Cache
A vehicle fitted with all-wheel steering increases its Handling characteristic by 1. This Upgrade cannot be taken by a vehicle with either the Skimmer or Walker special rule.
A vehicle fitted with this antigrav generators gains the Skimmer special rule, replacing whatever its current Locomotion special rule is.
Whenever this vehicle moves due to a failed Loss of Control test, halve the distance travelled.
A vehicle fitted with pneumatic radials does not suffer any penalty to its movement for traversing difficult terrain. This Upgrade can only be taken by a vehicle with the Wheeled Locomotion rule.
When performing a Move (Simple) action, this vehicle may make two turns of up to 90° at any point before, during or after its move, rather than the usual one.
A vehicle fitted with a redundant drive system treats the first non-Glancing Hit it suffers to the Drive location in each battle as a Glancing Hit.
A vehicle fitted with tyre claws increases its Handling characteristic by 1.

A vehicle fitted with an archaeotech automantic reactor increases its Movement characteristic by 2". When the vehicle is Wrecked, the reactor explodes; all models within 3" suffer a S5, AP -1, D1 hit, and the vehicle is then removed.
A vehicle fitted with an easy turnover applies a +1 modifier to any checks to restart its engine.
A vehicle fitted with an engine shell treats the first non-Glancing Hit it suffers to the Engine location in each battle as a Glancing Hit.
Each time this vehicle moves, any models within 1" of the vehicle at any point during its move suffer a S3, AP -1, D1 hit with the Blaze trait from the flames belching out of the exhausts.
Once per battle, when it is activated, a vehicle fitted with a glys injector can increase its Movement characteristic by 4" for the duration of its activation.
A vehicle fitted with a nitro burner increases its Movement characteristic by 1".

When this vehicle is activated, its Movement characteristic can be increased by 2"; however, if it is, then after the activation is finished roll a D6. On a result of a 1, the engine overheats and the vehicle loses 1 HP.
This vehicle is constantly shrouded by clouds of smoke; all ranged attacks targeting it suffer a -1 penalty to hit. This effect is ignored by anything that ignores the Smoke weapon trait.
A fighter attempting to jump from a vehicle fitted with a boarding ramp to another vehicle within 3" adds 1 to its Initiative check.

Any time a fighter moves on a vehicle fitted with body spikes (except when moving on a Transport area), they must make an Initiative test. If failed, they suffer an automatic S3, AP -, D1 hit. This attack does not pin them.

If a vehicle fitted with booby-trapped fuel tanks is Wrecked, roll a D6 every time a fighter moves within 3" of it. On a 5+ the vehicle explodes; every model within 5" takes a S6, AP -1, D1 hit with the Blaze trait. Once it has exploded, a vehicle equipped with booby- trapped fuel tanks is removed from the battlefield and must then roll on the Lasting Damage table (apply this result in addition to the result rolled when the vehicle was wrecked).

A vehicle fitted with a caltrop launcher may make the Lay Caltrops (Basic) action. Lay Caltrop (Basic): The vehicle moves forwards in a straight line up to its Movement characteristic; no turns may be made. At any point during this move, up to three markers can be placed on the battlefield within the vehicle’s Rear arc and within 1" of the vehicle. Any time a vehicle with the Wheeled special rule moves within 1" of a caltrop marker, they must make a Loss of Control test with a -2 modifier.

A vehicle fitted with flare launchers may perform the Launch Flares (Basic) action. Launch Flares (Basic): All models, including this vehicle, within 12" of this vehicle gain the Revealed condition until the start of the End phase.

A vehicle fitted with headlights can turn them on or off at the start of their activation; they remain in the selected state until their next activation. While they are on, all models within 12", in Line of Sight and within the vehicle’s Front arc are Revealed. In addition, while the headlights are on, the vehicle equipped with them is also Revealed.
If this vehicle is Wrecked as a result of a hit to the Engine, subtract one from the Lasting Damage table roll.

One use only per battle. A vehicle fitted with a minelayer may make the Lay Mine (Basic) action. Each additional mine purchased allows the Lay Mine (Basic) action to be performed one extra time per battle.,{'Actions':{'Lay Mine'}}"
A vehicle fitted with smoke launchers may make the Launch Smoke (Basic) action.
If a vehicle fitted with Wheel Scythes moves within 1" of a model, that model takes a S3, AP -, D1 hit, and if they are a fighter they are Pinned.
